alert.note: Alert for Knox (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 8:59PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Knox County through 945 PM EDT... At 859 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Utica, or 7 miles southwest of Mount Vernon, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Vernon, Gambier, Utica, Martinsburg and Bladensburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
